The ‘get_admin_sf’ function

Source: vignettes/get_admin_sf.Rmd
get_admin_sf.Rmd

get_admin_sf is a simple API wrapper for the ONS Open Geography Portal, facilitating easy use of shapefiles and making drawing maps of the UK administrative boundaries a dream.

It is easy to ‘get’ shapefiles for several UK administrative geographies:

  • Countries

  • Regions (ENGLAND ONLY)

  • Upper Tier Local Authorities

  • Local Authority Districts

For example this fetches a shape file of the countries that make up the UK:

library(ukgeog)

sf <- get_admin_sf("NAT")

Drawing maps with your shapefile

If crs = 4326 (the default) it is easy to map your shapefile using base R as well as popular packages such as ggplot2 and leaflet

-plot-

plot(sf$geometry)

-ggplot2-

library(ggplot2)

ggplot(sf) +
  geom_sf() +
  theme_void()

-leaflet-

library(leaflet)

leaflet(sf) %>%
  addTiles() %>%
  addPolygons()
